Name: La Fièré: 12 Scenarios that Chronicle the Battle for La Fièré
Description:
La Fièré contains 12 skirmish and company level scenarios that may be played with 6-54mm miniatures.

It chronicles the combat experience of the 82nd Airborne Division from the early hours of 6 June 1944 through the capture of Manoir de La Fièré and the vital bridge across the Merderet River.

—description from the designer

Name: The Varvarivskyi Bridge
Description: The Varvarivskyi Bridge is a scenario opposing DEVGRU and Ukrainian Nationalists to Spetsnaz and Ukrainian Separatists.

Name: Final Combat: Medal of Honor – Skirmish Scenarios Vol.1
Description:
Final Combat: Medal of Honor is a series of skirmish scenarios that allows you to recreate the heroic exploits of Second World War medal recipients.

In this Western European Theatre tribute, you will be able to read the extraordinary accounts of how these soldiers overcame insurmountable odds in the prosecution of their duty.  
The character sheets will endow you with the attributes of these great men.  
Just fill in your name and see if you can replicate their conspicuous gallantry and intrepidity at the risk of life above and beyond the call of duty.

—description from the publisher

Name: Final Combat: Medal of Honor – Skirmish Scenarios Vol. 2
Description:
Medal of Honor Skirmish Scenarios Vol. 2 continues the immensely popular series that allows the player to recreate the heroic exploits of Second World War, Western European medal recipients.

Can you replicate their uncommon valor above and beyond the call of duty?

—description from the publisher

Name: Micro Melee: Battle of Prokhorovka – 13 Company Level Scenarios Based Upon the Southern Pincer at Kursk
Description:
Micro Melee: Battle of Prokhorovka contains 13 company level scenarios that chronicle the action south of the Kursk salient from 10–12 July 1943.

Although these scenarios are written for Micro Melee, they should translate well to most rules designed for company sized engagements of WWII.

—description from the publisher

Name: Micro Melee: Black Watch – II Canadian Corps at Normandy in 15 Company Level Scenarios
Description:
Micro Melee: Black Watch contains 15 company level scenarios that chronicle the II Canadian Corps' struggle during Operation Spring.

It also features one of Canada's most celebrated battalions, The Black Watch, as they stormed Verrières Ridge that fateful day on 25 July 1944.

Although written for Micro Melee, it will translate well to most company level rules.

—description from the publisher

Name: Micro Melee: Boot Camp – Light company level WWII scenarios
Description:
Boot Camp comprises a series of eight scenarios that introduce players to the Micro Melee system in digestible portions without players having to read the entire rule book before getting into action.

This book also includes appendices that contain already prepared unit sheets and quick reference tables to reduce the preparation time for each scenario.

Not a Micro Melee player?  
No problem, each of the historical company-level scenarios can be translated easily into other systems.

—description from the publisher

Name: Micro Melee: Bourguébus Ridge – 16 company level scenarios that chronicle the 11th Armored Division's experience during Operation Goodwood
Description:
Micro Melee: Bourguébus Ridge chronicles the combat experience of the British 11th Armored Division on 18 and 19 July, 1944 during Operation Goodwood.

The story is told in 16 scenarios that should translate well to most company level rules.

—description from the publisher

Name: Operation Bagration: The 1944 Soviet Offensive – Skirmish Scenarios for Final Combat
Description:
On June 22, 1944, three years to the day after Germany's 1941 invasion of the Soviet Union, the Red Army launched a massive offensive in Byelorussia.  
Code-name Operation Bagration, it climaxed five weeks later with the Red Army at the gates of Warsaw.

This book contains 10 scenarios that chronicle the great Soviet summer offensive of 1944.

Although designed for use with Final Combat, these scenarios will translate well to other skirmish rules.

—description from the publisher

Name: Operation Stryker Denial: 12 Scenarios based on the Seige of Sadr City
Description:
Operation Stryker Denial 
contains 12 scenarios that depict the US Army's effort to eliminate the Jaish al-Mahdi Militia's ability to shell the green zone from nearby Sadr City.

It takes place in the spring of 2008 and highlights the 1st Squadron, 2nd Stryker Calvary Regiment's combat experience.

—description from the publisher

Name: Peleliu: Operation Stalemate II – Eleven Skirmish Scenarios that Chronicle the 1st Marine Division Fight for Peleliu
Description:
Peleliu: Operation Stalemate II

contains eleven skirmish scenarios that chronicle the experience of the 1st Marine Division during the bloody battle for Peleliu in September of 1944.

—description from the publisher

Name: Rhodesian Bush War: 10 Skirmish and Company Level Wargame Scenarios
Description:
Rhodesian Bush War contains 10 scenarios based upon the Rhodesian Civil War (1964-80).

The book is not designed for any particular rules set and uses generic troop quality, leadership and weapons skills.

Although largely fictional, the scenarios are inspired by Faan Martin and Dan Tharp's memoirs.

—description from the publisher

Name: Rising Sun: Operation Galvanic – Company Level Scenarios that Chronicle the 2nd Marine Division's Struggle at Tarawa
Description:
Rising Sun: Operation Galvanic

Written for Micro Melee and company level engagements, this book is the second in the Rising Sun series.

It examines the 2nd Marine Division's struggle at Tarawa in 12 scenarios.

—description from the publisher

Name: Rising Sun: Operation Watchtower – Company Level Skirmish Scenarios for 6-15mm that Chronicle The Battle for Guadalcanal
Description:
Rising Sun: Operation Watchtower  contains 12 company level scenarios (for 6–15mm miniatures) which chronicle the Battle of Guadalcanal.

Although written for Micro Melee, it should translate well to other rule sets of similar scale.

—description from the publisher

Name: Final Combat: Skirmish Scenarios
Description:
Final Combat Skirmish Scenarios is a collection of twelve scenarios that are designed to be played with Final Combat.

However, they are adaptable to many WWII skirmish rules sets.

—description from the publisher

Name: Final Combat: Solitaire Soldiers – Ten Encounters Designed for Solo or Cooperative Play
Description:
Solitaire Soldiers offers the player a WWII campaign experience that uses a role-playing format with miniatures.

It includes ten encounters that are designed to be played alone or cooperatively with a friend.

It chronicles the combat experience of a squad from the 116th Regiment of the 29th Infantry Division as they fight their way across Normandy during the summer of 1944.

—description from the publisher

Name: Star Troopers: Crash Test
Description:
Star Troopers: Crash Test is a solitaire card game of management with a scifi survival/escape scenario and set in a procedural environment. Player is in the role of the captain of a freighter ship stranded on an abandoned space station whose crew was killed by the latest result of the research and development of an anonymous transtellar conglomerate in the field of bioweapons, the Geno.

To help you, you will find many Items by searching Location cards. Additional weapons and their ammunitions but also Medikits and other helpful tools such as Decoys, Torchlights or even an Hazard Suit may be used to counter the various Conditions and Events you will encounter on the different Location cards in addition to the potential attacks by the Geno.

You will have to choose wisely between all these Items because carrying too much of them may hinder your progression in the space station or make you produce noise which will alert the Geno of your presence, triggering a Fight with an unkillable foe.

You must get to the last card of the Location deck, labelled Control, and survive the final confrontation with the Geno to win the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Stealth Invasion: 10 Scenarios Based on the Ukrainian Crisis
Description:
Stealth Invasion examines the 2014 Ukrainian Crisis through 10 modern squad to company level scenarios.

Although play-tested with SOF Warrior and Micro Melee: Modern Warfare, it is not written for a particular rules set.

—description from the publisher

Name: Terror at Sea: A SOF Warrior Mission Pack
Description:
Terror at Sea 
is a SOF Warrior Mission Pack in which players take the role of special forces operatives, tasked with rescuing hostages on board a cruise ship.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Last Offensive: Go from Budapest to Balaton in 20 Company Level Scenarios
Description:
The Last Offensive contains 20 squad to company level scenarios that examine Hitler's attempt to rescue the garrison trapped in Budapest and the final offensive near Lake Balaton.

Although it has been play-tested with Final Combat and Micro Melee, it is not designed with any particular rules set in mind.

Name: The Skirmish Collection: WWII Scenarios
Description:
The Skirmish Collection: WWII Scenarios

This set of 10 skirmish scenarios was developed by a recognized scenario designer in the war-gaming community.

All of them have been presented at Fall In, Cold Wars, Little Wars, or Historicon and garnered eight HMGS best game awards in the process.

Although designed for Final Combat, you can play these historical scenarios with your favorite skirmish rules in any scale.

—description from the publisher

Name: Tier One: 15 Modern Skirmish Scenarios for SOF Warrior
Description:
Tier One contains 15 modern day skirmish scenarios designed for SOF Warrior.

Although these scenarios are largely fictional, they are taken from real world events.

It is recommended that a game master take the part of the insurgents, while the players assume the role of the SOF operatives.

—description from the publisher

Name: Final Combat: Trench Raiders – Supplemental Rules for World War One
Description:
Trench Raiders is not a complete set of rules (you must have Final Combat for it to be useful), but rather a supplement that enables you to experience the horror of trench warfare in Western Europe from 1916–18.

It introduces new rules and includes one historical scenario based on a British trench raid in 1916.

So, whether you play as a Doughboy, Poilu, Tommy or Storm-trooper, the strength of Final Combat is the manner in which it simulates mêlée on a gaming table; thus providing the perfect venue for a close quarter battle trench raid.

—description from the publisher

Name: WWII Eastern Front Skirmish Scenarios
Description:
WWII Eastern Front Skirmish Scenarios is a collection of 12 miniature skirmish scenarios.

These scenarios are presented in a format that makes them easily playable with any set of rules that you may wish to use.  
Playtests were made using both 20mm and 28mm figures, and rules used were Soldat, Final Combat, Arc of Fire, Face of Combat, Rules of Engagement, Battleground, Nuts, Seven Brothers, and various sets of house rules.

The scenarios included are:

     Battle of the Bzura 1939 Poland
     Operation Winter Storm 1942 Russia
     Fall Blau 1942 Russian Caucuses
     Pavlov's House 1942 Stalingrad
     Stalingrad Sniper Hunt 1942 Stalingrad (The only non historical scenario)
     Kharkov Must be Held 1943 Ukraine
     Defending Etligen 1943 Crimea
     The Battle of Krasny Bor 1943 Russia
     Tempelhof Bahn Station 1945 Berlin
     Lake Balaton 1945 Hungary
     Breakout at Baruth 1945 Germany
     Fall of Konigsberg 1945 Germany


Each scenario gives: 
Historical Situation – the background to the actual action of which the skirmish game is ‘part of’. All of the scenarios are based on historical occurrences in the ‘big picture’. The action takes place as a ‘piece’ of this big picture, often revolving around some key action.

Orders of Battle and Mission Briefing - Each side is given fixed number of troops and a mission briefing, what the orders are and how to achieve your objective. It is best if only one side is privy to their mission briefing.

A Map – The maps are grid based and most tables are large if you were to play in 28mm.

Judges notes – Final Combat works best if you use a games-master and the scenarios are really geared for this. In this section they will find guidelines for running the game, how to keep it tense, when to divulge information etc. But don’t worry if you don’t use a. This section includes the ‘Special Scenario rules’, which cover a wide range of detail from special movement, artillery incoming, communications, special morale considerations etc.

Victory Conditions – Sometimes these are specific conditions that need to be met, sometimes they are a point based system.

Name: Deathwager
Description:
Deathwager is a bluffing and strategy game, containing 38 tarot size cards and a steel token. Players collect red "Eye" Cards, looking for Hearts or Skulls symbols. The orientation of the King card determines the fate of the players: a living King upwards means the winning player will be the one with the most Hearts on her cards, whereas a dead King favors the Skulls.

—description from the publisher

Name: Commonwealth Skirmish Scenarios: World War II – ETO 1940-45
Description:
Commonwealth Skirmish Scenarios

This book contains 14 scenarios suitable for use with any set of WWII skirmish rules. 
The scenarios are presented for use with Soldat II, but we have included a conversion chart for the following rules: Arc of Fire, BAPS, Battlefront, Battleground, Disposable Heroes, Final Combat, Nuts, and Rules of Engagement. 
  

     Operation Dynamo  1940 (British)
     Operation Archery   1941   (British)
     Operation Jubilee   1942   (Canadian)
     Operation Perch  1944   (British)
     Operation Martlet   1944  (British)
     Operation Epsom   1944  (British)
     Operation Windsor  1944   (Canadian)
     Operation Charnwood   1944  (Canadian)
     Operation Spring   1944   (Canadian)
     Operation Bluecoat  1944  (British)
     Operation Totalize  1944   (Canadian)
     Operation Tractable  1944   (Canadian)
     Operation Dragoon  1944   (British)
     Operation Varsity  1945   (British)

Name: WWII Skirmish Scenarios
Description:
With the release of WWII Skirmish Scenarios, Britton Publishers returns to The Second World War with a vengeance.

Experience a variety of seldom done skirmishes such as a roadblock during the retreat to the Gothic line in Italy, Edson's Ridge on Guadalcanal, Lord Lovat's success during the Dieppe Raid, the Hürtgen Forest and more.

Name: Z-Men: 10 Scenarios Based on the WWII Exploits of Australia's Z-Special Unit
Description:
Z-Men seeks to chronicle the combat experience of the SOA (Special Operations – Australia) in the jungles and on the beaches of New Guinea, Timor Leste, Malaysia and Indonesia during the struggle against the Japanese from 1942-45.

Although these 10 historical scenarios were play-tested with Final Combat and Micro Melee, they can be enjoyed with most WWII squad to company level rules.

—description from the publisher

Name: Wopono
Description:
The Story: The Wopono alien family lands on earth !
Their arrival brings about an upheaval in the region. Madness seizes the inhabitants even changing their earthly appearance. These mutations are the direct consequence of the energy, coming from the cubes, which hovers above cereal crops. Join this crazy adventure at home.

The Goal: Win a maximum of zap in 3 rounds or more. 
Move your character in the neighborhood to collect 5 cards.
With them, make a story to win medals of the most thoughtful story, funny or crazy!
By a voting game, win the round by accumulating the most medals! The winner of the game is the one that gets the highest score.
The game time is flexible, depending on the number of challenges. But not only that ! You will be able to modulate your all game too.

—description from the publisher

Name: Neko Neko Racing
Description:
This time the cats start the race! Run the in-course as much as possible and aim for the goal.

Trick-taking game It is easy and easy to understand even for beginners.

The perfect game to play with your family with your kids.

Players play cards from their hands to win tricks. Players that win tricks move their car. Win enough to earn the boost!

Even beginners of trick taking can do. It's EASY!

Name: Now and Then
Description:
Now and Then is more than a game, it's a tool for people who want to involve their loved ones in the process of thinking through their end of life plan and legacy – not just telling them what their wishes are once they’ve already been decided, but including them in the work of figuring it all out in the first place.

Because this can be a pretty exhausting process, both emotionally and practically, we’ve made this tool into a board game. That makes the whole experience lighter, more joyful, and easier to invite people into. Perfect for couples, families, and close friends.

—description from the designer

Name: RPG Dice Quest
Description:
RPG Dice Quest is a dice game were you and/or your friends play as a guild who is going through a dungeon to defeat the Overlord. Going through each room with different events that could happen in them. Collecting gold, fighting creatures, and defeating the Overlord is what you will be experiencing with every playthrough.

After having everything set up, you pick a direction to go in and then pick whichever option within that space to act upon. While moving from room to room, you can either fight and something on the floor. It's all your choice to do so.

—description from the designer

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Eighth Edition): Codex Adeptus Astartes – Space Marines
Description:
Codex: Space Marines is an expansion book for the Adeptus Astartes army in the 8th Edition of Warhammer 40,000.

This book contains everything needed to get a Space Marines army ready for war! A huge collection of rules content is within:

85 datasheets covering the entire Space Marines range – including the Primaris Space Marines

Points values for all miniatures, weapons and wargear for use in Matched Play games

Army abilities and wargear lists, alongside a brief explanation of their use and the use of keywords

Rules profiles for every piece of wargear and every weapon in the Space Marines’ arsenal

Rules for Battle-forged armies, including abilities for Space Marines armies and specific Chapter Tactics for Ultramarines, White Scars, Imperial Fists, Black Templars, Salamanders, Raven Guard and Iron Hands Chapters, reflecting their unique fighting styles

26 Stratagems for Battle-forged armies, reflecting the varied tactics used by Space Marines commanders on the battlefield

6 Warlord Traits, for use with any Space Marine Warlord, with Chapter-specific Warlord traits for Ultramarines, White Scars, Imperial Fists, Crimson Fists, Black Templars, Salamanders, Raven Guard and Iron Hands

Chapter Relics: special weapons and wargear wielded in battle by Space Marines characters

the Librarius psychic discipline: 6 psychic abilities for use by Space Marines Librarians

6 Tactical Objectives for use by Space Marines armies.

Name: Combat Command: The Bulge to Berlin – Army Lists for December 1944 - May 1945: European Theater
Description:
Combat Command: The Bulge to Berlin adds army lists for the forces of the USSR, the British Commonwealth, Germany and the United States for the final months of the war in northern Europe for Combat Command and other similar platoon level games.  
The module covers the period between December 1944 through the surrender of Germany in May 1945.  
All the combatants major armor and infantry organizations are covered as well as Germany's ad hoc last defender battle groups.

It also provides rules for converting historical research for battles fought in this period into a balanced game as well as methods for setting up hypothetical battles between two evenly matched forces.  A full terrain generation system is included.

Besides the orders of battle the module also includes an historical scenario, the Battle of Rodt, which illustrates how to create historical battles using this module.

—description from the publisher

Name: Combat Command: Bagration to Budapest – Army Lists: Eastern Front June 1944 to November 1944
Description:
This addition to the innovative Combat Command system includes full Army Lists for the Eastern Front from June 1944 through November 1944.  
These lists allow players to recreate typical historical battalion sized units to use in tournaments or hypothetical battles.  
In addition a section covers how to create well balanced battles based on actual historical match ups.  
This section can be used with virtually any platoon based system.

Lists are provided for German Infantry, Panzer and Volksgrenadier Battlegroups.  
The Russian lists cover Tank and Mechanized Corps as well as Rifle and Cavalry units.  
In addition there are complete listings for Rumanian, Hungarian and Finish allied units.

This supplement requires at least a copy of Combat Command - the Basic Game to use. 
To make full use of all features of the Army Lists a copy of the Advanced Game is also recommended.

—description from the publisher

Name: Combat Command: Poland to Paris – Army Lists for September 1939 to July 1940
Description:
This Army List Supplement covers the allied armies of Belgium, France, the Netherlands and Poland in their desperate struggle against Germany in the earliest days of World War II.

Specifically designed for Battalion level games such as Combat Command, this supplement includes complete rules for hypothetical battles between roughly evenly matched Battlegroups.  
In addition it covers using the Battlegroup System to recreate historical battles.

All Battalion level units are covered from German Panzer Battalions to Dutch Marines mounted on bicycles.  
Complete equipment lists cover the many rare vehicles used in this period – everything from Polish TKS tankettes to French Char B heavy tanks.

—description from the publisher

Name: Nineveh: No Mercy
Description:
Nineveh: No Mercy is a series of 5 card battles in which the player playing the red deck plays 2 cards, while the player playing the blue deck plays 3 cards.  The higher total wins the battle.

Nineveh: No Mercy is based on true historical events.  Starting in 626 BC, a series of civil wars have weakened the Assyrian Empire, thus emboldening occupied territories to unite in rebellion to topple the Empire.  In No Mercy, the 22 red point cards represent the Assyrian army (The Wicked City of Nineveh being their capital), and the 33 blue point cards represent the coalition forces of the Babylonians, the Medes and the Persians.  The Assyrian forces are more skilled and valued at 11 points per card, coalition forces are more numerous but less skilled and valued at 7 points per card.  As the Assyrian general you command the 22 red point cards while your opponent commands the 33 blue point cards of the coalition forces.

There will be a series of 11 battles and the player who wins most of these battles gains a victory point. In each of these 11 battles, the Assyrian general plays 2 red cards against the coalition general’s 3 blue cards.  After each conflict consisting of 11 battles, the players switch armies/colors and become the new general of the opposing army.  The 1st player to win 2 victory points wins the War, thus ending the game. In case of a tie, a 3rd conflict is necessary to determine the winner.

As the Assyrian general, are you skilled enough to defeat the much larger coalition force?  As the coalition general, can you overwhelm the Assyrian forces with your superior numbers?

—description from the designer

Name: Nineveh: Tug-of-War
Description:
Nineveh: Tug-of-War is a series of 6 card battles in which each player plays 3 cards each.  The higher blue or red total wins!

Nineveh: Tug-of-War is based on true historical events.  After the death of the Assyrian King Ashurbanipal in 631BC, a series of civil wars ensued between his sons, Prince Ashuretli and Prince Sinshar, in a struggle for control of the throne.  As a top general representing a Prince, the chaos has created your path into power.  In this battle of Tug of War, you must defeat your rival to end the civil war as your prince assumes the throne in Nineveh and rules the Assyrian Empire.

In this civil war, you will lead both Assyrian forces (red cards) and foreign forces (blue cards) in your attempt to gain control of the empire.  Each player alternates playing offense and defense and can only defeat a city during an offensive attack to gain a victory point.  On defense, you will defend 3 cities sympathetic to your cause, giving you an advantage by getting to pick either red or blue forces to defend with and by also adding reinforcements to bolster your defense. Lose these 3 cities and you lose the civil war.

The mixed loyalties in this civil war have caused great mistrust between your Assyrian forces (red cards) and your foreign forces (blue cards), causing you to form 2 different armies.  Your Assyrian force has little will to fight rival Assyrian forces.  Your foreign forces also have little will to fight rival foreign forces.  So, when you decide to defend a city with either red or blue cards, your opponent must attack with the opposite colored force.

Do you have the military expertise necessary to defeat your opponent? Are you savvy enough to trap your opponent into wasting resources and to capitalize on their mistakes, or will you be defeated in this civil war?

—description from the designer

Name: OMV Resourcefulness Challenge
Description:
OMV's Resourcefulness Challenge is an exciting strategy game developed especially by OMV employees for OMV employees. It is also great fun for your friends and family with an interest in Resourcefulness. It playfully illustrates how business decisions, combined with a sense of responsibility and sustainability, are the key to commercial success along OMV's entire value chain.

Apply your own investment strategy to achieve long-term win-win situations that are beneficial to society, the environment and OMV. Be aware, because you will have to deal with plenty of unforseen challenges but will also force opportunities along the way.

—description from the box

Name: Expansionist
Description:
Expansionist is a board game of land and event tiles set in a fictitious medieval world. As the leader of your people you head the push across the mountains to newly discovered, uninhabited, fertile lands. Once there you must lay down your claim and build your settlements. But other communities are flooding through and you must race to secure the best chance for your people. If you become the most advanced and therefore the most settled, then you win the game!

—description from the designer

Name: Council For The Crown
Description:
The King is dead and has no heir. Since his death, the Council For The Crown is trying to choose the next kingdom's leader. The one who will deserve this title and succeed to the last king will have to be the best. To prove yourself, you'll have to show your capacity to manage the various kingdom’s resources and to deploy your army throughout the known lands. You’ll have to develop new Cities to assure the realm's prosperity. Who among you has the makings of a fine strategist? Who will become the next sovereign?

The goal of “Council For The Crown” is to be the player with the most Glory points at the end of the game. You’ll earn Glory by wisely choosing your location at the Council table, by producing the right resources, by strategically deploying your armies and by contributing to Cities foundation. Recruit Templars in your ranks in order to keep control of your territories and dispatch Assassins in order to block your enemies plans. The game ends when 3 Cities or more are founded.

—description from the designer

Le Roi défunt n’avait aucun héritier. Depuis sa mort, le Conseil Pour La Couronne tente de choisir le prochain dirigeant du royaume. Celui ou celle qui méritera ce titre et qui succédera au dernier Roi devra être le meilleur. Pour ce faire, vous devrez démontrer votre capacité à gérer les ressources du royaume et à déployer votre armée afin de défendre les terres connues. Vous devrez développer de nouvelles Cités afin d'assurer la prospérité du royaume. Qui parmi vous a l’étoffe d’un fin stratège? Qui deviendra le prochain souverain?

L’objectif du jeu “Le Conseil Pour La Couronne” est d’être le joueur avec le plus de points de Gloire à la fin de la partie. Vous obtiendrez de la Gloire en choisissant judicieusement votre emplacement à la table du Conseil, en produisant les bonnes ressources, en déployant stratégiquement vos armées et en contribuant à la fondation de Cités. Recrutez des Templiers dans vos rangs afin de garder le contrôle de vos territoires et envoyez vos Assassins afin de nuire aux plans de vos adversaires. La partie prend fin lorsque 3 Cités ou plus sont fondées.

—description from the designer (French)

Name: Kitty race
Description:
An unpredictable race with balls of yarn, oil stains, and sudden surprises until the very last bend.
Create your track, play your cards and be the first to cross the finishing line!

Arrange the space pieces in a circle in the middle of the table to form a track. You can lay it out however you like.

You should all choose a player piece and place it on the finish line piece, then shuffle the cards and give everyone 3 each.

On your turn, pick up a card and move forward the amount of spaces indicated, then carry out any special action indicated on the card. If you end your move on a special space piece, apply the corresponding action.

Whoever reaches or moves beyond the finish line piece first is the winner.

-description from designer

Name: Abrakaboom
Description:
Serpent’s tail, bat’s wing, frog’s leg and owl’s eye... combine the ingredients and be the first to finish making your potion; cast the spells and become the top sorcerer!

Contents
132 cards, that include:

     96 ingredients. Each card has a number between 1 and 4, plus one ingredient.
     12 magic wands
     24 spells


12 special potion cards.

Shuffle the cards and give everyone 3 each, then place the rest in the middle of the table. Pick 3 cards and place them next to the pack together with the 12 special potion cards.

During your turn, carry out the following 2 actions in
sequence:
1) Take 3 cards from the middle of the table. You can draw them from the pack or choose from the revealed ones.
2) Put down a card, placing it next to the revealed cards in the middle of the table.

During your turn, you can also carry out the following 2 additional actions:
1) Cast a spell. Spells allow you to carry out a special action instantly.
2) Make a potion. A potion consists of a combination of 3 or 4 ingredients.
For a combination to be valid, the cards must have the same number and different ingredients or the same ingredients and different numbers. If you made one of the potions in the middle of the table first, take the corresponding special card and place it in front of you. If you have taken a special card with a spell, you should apply the effect
immediately.

When there are no more special cards left in the middle of the table or there are fewer than 3 cards in the pack you are drawing from, the game ends. Count one point for each face-down card in front of you and add the points indicated on the
special cards: whoever has the most points is the winner.

—description from the designer

Name: City of Glass
Description:
In this fast-paced worker placement and resource management game, you'll play as one of the best craftsman in the Kingdom contending for the Noble position of "Royal Jeweler".

You will need to be smart, fast & tactical if you want to beat the competition!


     Send your workers to bid on chosen custom jewelry contracts.
     Collect raw materials (Gems, Ore, Pearls) to use when making jewelry so you can fulfill your chosen contracts. Fulfilling a contract will gain you experience.
     Use your experience to attract and befriend Noble's who want to use you for heirloom pieces and who will spread the word about you to their friends, which will earn you the much coveted "Fame".
     Build up enough "Fame" to take home the prize and become the "Royal Jeweler"!



    Game Setup#
     Each player choose a color and collect the 3 worker meeples of that color, then take a work station card and place it in front of them.
     Place the raw material card within reach of all players. Place all gems in their spots.
     Shuffle the Noble cards and place a number equal to 1 plus the number of players to form the top row of the "board".
     Shuffle the Contract cards, cut the deck in half and flip one side, then shuffle again and deal out 3 contracts face up in rows below each Noble to complete the "board".
     Begin (Use your chosen method for deciding who takes the first turn).


Steps of each turn
Place/Move Workers - to bid on contracts. In this step you will send each of you available workers to bid on a specific contract.  If you have no available workers, you may move 1 worker from an uncontested contract and reassign it to any other contract. (Uncontested means that your worker is the only worker bidding on that contract.  If another player has placed a worker on any contract that your worker is bidding on, it becomes "contested" and neither worker can move until one of the players fulfills the contract)

Gather Raw Materials - Roll the 3 dice and either collect those 3 raw materials, or sacrifice one of the 3 dice and re-roll the remaining 2 dice.  Then either collect those 2 raw materials or sacrifice 1 dice and re-roll the remaining 1 dice and collect the raw material from the result.  (This indicates you going deeper into the bazaar in search of the perfect gemstone, but often you won't find it and you will never get the best deal)          
Place all raw materials onto your work station in the appropriate space

The Main Step - During the Main step of your turn you will choose from 1 of 4 potential actions. (Limited to a single action per turn)


     Complete a contract - If you have the required raw materials on your work station, you may choose to complete one of the contracts that your worker has bid on.  Once you complete a contract, you will take it and place it under the lower part of your workstation so that only the "Experience" section remains showing (See Action Shot).  Then return any workers that were bidding on the contract back to their owners and replace the contract by dealing one from the "Contract" deck.
     Befriend a Noble - If you have collected enough "Experience" to befriend a Noble, you may do so.  Do so by taking the Noble that you want to befriend and placing it beneath the top portion of your work station so that only the gold star "Fame" symbol is showing (See Action Shot).  Then replace that Noble with one from the top of the "Nobles" deck. If the Noble you befriend adds enough "Fame" for you to win the game, you win as soon as you befriend him/her and the game ends.  (Shuffle up and play again)
     Bribe a Noble - For the low cost of twice the "Fame" rating of a Noble (Payable using any gems or gold from your stockpile), you can bribe them to leave the board and be replaced with the top Noble from the deck.  This tactic comes in very handy if, for instance, you see that your opponent is going to win or close to being able to befriend a Noble that may turn the game to their advantage.  Also good to help clear Nobles that aren't a good fit for the current "board".
     Pass - Occasionally there is nothing that you can do with your current worker placement or workstation stockpile.  When that happens, you can simply pass and end your turn.


Winning the game
Solo Mode - Playing this game solo is a race against the clock!  You will play "Easy, Normal or Hard mode" by trying to reach 3,4 or 5 stars of "Fame" faster than the creator's best score AND before the 12 turn clock ends and you lose the game outright!  Keep track of your personal best scores using the space allotted in the back of the rule book.

Normal Mode (2-6 Players) - When playing with other people, the goal is to become the most famous jeweler before they do.  The objective will be to reach a level of "Fame" equal to 1 plus the number of players. **EX.**3 players is 1+3=4 stars of "Fame" to win.  The first person to reach the "Fame" amount required wins immediately after befriending the Noble whose "Fame" rating puts them over the top!

—description from the publisher

Name: Zoo Goal!
Description:
Choose your team and challenge your opponent.
You will have 5 animal teams and lots of special cards for animated games that keep you on the edge of your seat!

Contents:
132 cards that include:

     5 animal teams made up of 25 cards each. Most of the cards fall within the numerical range of 1 and 11, plus a possible special action. Some cards show a referee.
     1 football pitch made up of 7 cards.


1 ball
12 goal counters

Choose your team and take your pack of 25 cards, then draw 3 cards.
Each player will have a covered card in front of them which must be turned over at exactly the same time that the opponent turns over theirs. The player with the highest card wins the tackle and moves the ball across to the next pitch card. Draw another card from your pile of cards and play again.

If the ball ends up on the pitch card with the penalty box and you win the tackle, the ball goes into the opponent’s goal and you score! Move the ball into a midfield position and start playing again.

On some cards there is a special action. Some examples: move the ball 3 cards forwards, stop the ball, beats 10 and 11.

When all the cards have run out, the first half of the match is over. The match finishes once the second half is over. The player with most goal wins.

—description from the designer

Name: Sblocca la porta pocket
Description:
Sblocca la porta pocket is the pocket version of the escape room for children Sblocca la porta.

You are locked in a room and you must work together to find the way out, solving puzzles of logic, observation and mathematics. Use the objects you find in the room, observe the smallest details and do not be rushed: if you correctly solve all puzzles, you will leave the room!

The box includes 3 adventures: The mysterious museum, A day at Luna Park, Doktor Frank's laboratory.

-description from designer

Name: Who Goes There: Barclay and Benning Character Expansion Pack
Description: Each character has their own unique abilities and specialty cards ready to help them. With this character pack, Who Goes There can expand to accommodate 5-6 characters. Characters are also interchangeable and can be swapped out to create different teams and add more variety to your game.

Name: Who Goes There: Caldwell and Connant Character Expansion Pack
Description: Each character has their own unique abilities and specialty cards ready to help them. With this character pack, Who Goes There can expand to accommodate 5-6 characters. Characters are also interchangeable and can be swapped out to create different teams and add more variety to your game.

Name: Mean Gene's Match-up Football
Description: MGMF is a Pro and College American football play-by-play statistical simulation/replay game that uses two different double sided fast action decks of 100 cards each. The game also uses team cards with ratings for all position players in conjunction with the fast action cards to give the results of nearly everything that can happen in a football game.

Name: Small Game Hunting
Description:
The do gooders had largely put an end to big game hunting this was a problem until with a total disregard for the laws of physics someone created a way to shrink people to one inch in height and the sport of small game hunting was born.

Pick a few hunters and prepare to face whatever the average garden can throw at you, all you need is a handfull of 28mm figures/player and assorted model spiders, beetles and so on readily available from most toy shops.

—description from the publisher

Name: Fast Action Football
Description: FAF is a play by play statistical simulation of Pro and college American football implemented by the use of 60 fast action cards and ratings of all offensive skill player positions vs team defensive ratings.

Name: Eclipse: Second Dawn for the Galaxy – Worlds Afar Collection
Description:
Stretch Goals associated with the Kickstarter for Eclipse: Second Dawn for the Galaxy. Includes:


    Optional Turn Order Variant
    Galactic Events (Including Nebula, Supernova, Black Hole, and Pulsar)
    Minor Species
    Rift Cannon
    Terran Ships
    Ship Stands
    2 X Extra Dice (Translucent)
    6 X Resource and Game Sheets
    3 X Blueprint Tiles
    Scorepad
    New Rule Sheet for Worlds Afar Collection

Name: Warcaster: Neo-Mechanika
Description:
Warcaster: Neo-Mechanika is a high-speed hobby miniatures game for two players who each take on the role of a powerful Warcaster in command of a formidable battle force. Players assemble and customize a force of 20–30 models and fight a scenario-driven battle using dice and cards to control their mighty units and to cast epic cyphers. The game is played using an alternating-activation turn sequence with a round tracker that governs scoring opportunities and the duration of ongoing effects. Players take turns activating units one at a time and using their rack of cyphers, reality-warping spells that can be used to enhance their troops and warjacks or to devastate their opponent’s forces.

While the Warcaster is not physically present on the battlefield, their presence is always felt. A Warcaster coordinates and supports their forces from a sophisticated command and control center called a rack, located aboard a massive battle carrier that transports the Warcaster’s troops and warjacks. In the game, the rack is represented by a deck of cards—the spell-like cyphers—that players customize prior to the game based on the powers and abilities they wish to wield as a Warcaster.

—description from the publisher

Name: Chroni: L'Histoire de France
Description:
Chroni: L'Histoire de France ("The history of France") is a learning game with which we have fun gradually and durably memorizing the big dates. Ideal for the curious who wish to discover or rediscover History in all or simply or the amateurs who want to consolidate their knowledge.

A simple and clever game principle rewarded with a silver medal at the Concours Lépine in 2010.

Chroniis a card game where each card depicts a historical event, invention or discovery on both sides, with the year in which that event occurred, invention or discovery was made on only one side. Players take turns placing a card from their hand in a row on the table. After placing the card, the player reveals the date on it. If the card was placed correctly with the date in chronological order with all other cards on the table, the card stays in place; otherwise the card is removed from play and the player takes another card from the deck.

The first player to get rid of all his cards by placing them correctly wins. If multiple players go out in the same round, then everyone else is eliminated from play and each of those players are dealt one more card for another round of play. If only one player has no cards after a bonus round, he wins; otherwise play continues until a single player goes out.

Name: Chroni: Rois et Reines de France
Description:
Play to reconstruct the timeline of events and put history in order!

From the arrival in Gaul of Clodion the Long-haired (around 430) to the overthrow of Napoleon III (1871), find in this title a selection of 60 sovereigns who have marked the history of France.

Chroni - The Kings and Queens of France is a learning game with which we have fun gradually and durably memorizing the big dates. Ideal for the curious who wish to discover or rediscover History in all or simply or the amateurs who want to consolidate their knowledge.

Chroniis a card game where each card depicts a historical event, invention or discovery on both sides, with the year in which that event occurred, invention or discovery was made on only one side. Players take turns placing a card from their hand in a row on the table. After placing the card, the player reveals the date on it. If the card was placed correctly with the date in chronological order with all other cards on the table, the card stays in place; otherwise the card is removed from play and the player takes another card from the deck.

The first player to get rid of all his cards by placing them correctly wins. If multiple players go out in the same round, then everyone else is eliminated from play and each of those players are dealt one more card for another round of play. If only one player has no cards after a bonus round, he wins; otherwise play continues until a single player goes out.

Name: Street Wars NYC
Description:
Street Wars NYC is a miniatures game where gangs fight it out on 3’x3’ terrain-boards representing 70’s New York. 
Each gang-member has a rank, stats in Funk, Skill, Fight, Toughness and Range and also special abilities making them unique. A weapon makes even a lowly New Blood dangerous in a fight.
Each game is scenario-based and range from straight-up street-fights to a rescue missions. Each game has a certain number of turns that are broken down in four phases; Initiative, Activation, Recovery and End of Turn.
Activation uses Funk dice and can be successful (you can do a full action (move, fight, skill)), unsuccessful (you can move cautiously), or a fumble (you lose the initiative). 
Street-fighting can be chaotic as citizens, cops and Event Cards can disrupt even the best laid plan. 
In a one-off game you have a set amount of money to recruit gang-members and buy weaponry. In campaigns you fight to gain turf that will give funds that helps you recruit new gang members. They will gain experience after each scenario, helping them advance to higher levels, if they’re not wasted or arrested.

Name: The Silver River: Industrial Outposts
Description:
This deck contains 54 all new Explore Cards for the 4X game The Silver River. Extend your experience with new missions across Industrial sectors of the Milky Way galaxy.

Just replace the Explore Deck that came in your Silver River base game with this deck and you’ll be set to experience all new adventures!

—description from the publisher

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Eighth Edition): Psychic Awakening – Ritual of the Damned
Description:
Book 4 of the Psychic Awakening Series

The epic Psychic Awakening series continues with Ritual of the Damned. This campaign book features a host of new rules for the Thousand Sons, Dark Angels and Grey Knights. The campaign book also tells a sweeping narrative recounting the fiendish plan of the Daemon Primarch Magnus the Red, as well as the Prosperan Rift War that followed.

Inside this 88-page book, you'll find:


     Exciting background information on the immediate aftermath of the formation of the Great Rift and the plans that Magnus the Red and the Thousands Sons began formulating to further their own evil ends. Also includes the viewpoints of the Grey Knights and the Dark Angels and tells of their valiant efforts to prevent the Daemon Primarch’s plans from reaching fruition.
     Missions that allow you to recreate some of the most pivotal battles during the conflict, and war zones that let you bring your battles to some of the most distinctive sites that were fought over.
     Expanded army rules for the Thousand Sons, Dark Angels and Grey Knights, including Warlord Traits, Stratagems, Relics, and psychic powers.
     A new unit for the Grey Knights – the Grey Knights Chaplain – along with a set of six Litanies of Purity for them to utilise in battle.


—description from the publisher

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Eighth Edition): Psychic Awakening – The Greater Good
Description:
Book 5 of the Psychic Awakening Series

The epic Psychic Awakening series continues with The Greater Good. This campaign book features a host of new rules for the T’au Empire and Genestealer Cults. The campaign book also tells a sweeping narrative recounting the many unexpected challenges that the exploration fleets of the Fifth Sphere Expansion encountered as they journeyed beyond the Startide Nexus.

Inside this 80-page book, you'll find:


     Exciting background information on how the T'au sought to bring numerous disenfranchised Imperial worlds into the Greater Good, while having to deal with stoic Astra Militarum defenders and Genestealer Cult insurrections along the way
     Missions that allow you to recreate some of the most pivotal battles during the conflict, and war zones that let you bring your battles to some of the most distinctive sites that were fought over
     Expanded army rules for the T’au Empire, Astra Militarum and Genestealer Cults, including Warlord Traits, Stratagems, Relics, and psychic powers
     Rules for creating your own Sept Tenets, Regimental Doctrines and Cult Creeds!


—description from the publisher

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Eighth Edition): Psychic Awakening – Blood of Baal
Description:
Book 3 of the Psychic Awakening Series

The dark new era of warfare heralded by the Psychic Awakening continues apace, with the action now taking us to the Baal System – home of the mighty Blood Angels Chapter. Hive Fleet Leviathan is on its way, but can the full might of the legendary Sons of Sanguinius and their successor Chapters halt the swarm? Part rules manual, part thrilling narrative, this is your guide to the greatest threat that the Blood Angels have faced since they stood beside their Primarch in defence of Holy Terra more than 10 millennia ago.

Through thrilling lore, you'll read how the Blood Angles prepared to defend Baal against the full might of a Tyranid hive fleet, and what happened once battle was finally joined. Meanwhile, a vast set of rules expansions enhance your Blood Angels, Flesh Tearers and Tyranids armies with name generators, updated datasheets and much more besides.

Inside this 80* page book, you'll find:


      Riveting background that brings the terror of impending invasion by Hive Fleet Leviathan to thrilling life
      Missions that allow you to recreate some of the most pivotal battles that took place when angel met extragalactic horror
      Expanded army rules for the Blood Angels – including the Primaris version of Mephiston, Lord of Death – as well as their most storied successors, the Flesh Tearers
      Expanded army rules for the Tyranids, including new Stratagems, name generation tables, and a system that lets you build your own Hive Fleet Adaptations!


—description from the publisher

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Eighth Edition): Psychic Awakening – Faith & Fury
Description:
Book 2 of the Psychic Awakening Series

The epic Psychic Awakening series continues with Faith & Fury. This campaign book features a host of new rules for both the Adeptus Astartes and Heretic Astartes alike – as well as codex expansion's worth of rules for the mighty Black Templars Chapter! The campaign book also tells a sweeping narrative recounting the tapestry of heroism and villainy woven around the world of the Talledus System.

Inside this 96-page book, you'll find:


     Exciting background that describes how the time of the Great Rift found the Imperium reeling, assailed on a million fronts by the surging forces of Chaos. The Indomitus Crusade ventured deeper into occupied territory only to discover that the predations of the Great Enemy had intensified. The story then focuses on Talledus sub-sector – how the taint of Chaos had begun to take root there, lurking unnoticed for many years before the Great Rift enabled the Word Bearer fleets to make warp transit to the heart of the sub-sector.



     Missions that allow you to recreate some of the most pivotal battles during the conflict, and war zones that let you bring your battles to some of the most distinctive sites that were fought over.



     Expanded army rules for the Black Templars, including Warlord Traits, Stratagems, relics, Tactical Objectives and even a name generator for the legendary crusaders of Dorn!



     Expanded army rules for the Adeptus Astartes, including Chapter-specific Litanies of Battle as well as upgrades to Chaplains, Techmarines, Librarians, Apothecaries, Ancients, and Company Champions, providing more in-depth rules for these Chapter heroes.



     Expanded army rules for the Heretic Astartes, including Malicious Volleys, Daemon weapons, new Warlord Traits, Stratagems, relics, Tactical Objectives and name generators for each of the following Chaos Space Marine Legions: Word Bearers, Night Lords, Alpha Legion, Iron Warriors, Emperor's Children, and World Eaters.


—description from the publisher

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Eighth Edition): Psychic Awakening – Phoenix Rising
Description:
Book 1 of the Psychic Awakening Series

Enter a dark new era of warfare in Phoenix Rising – the first book in the epic Psychic Awakening series. Part rules manual, part thrilling narrative, this is your guide to perhaps the darkest challenge the Aeldari have ever faced – and perhaps, their greatest opportunity.

Through enticing lore, you'll discover the consequences of the opening of the Great Rift on the various factions of the Aeldari, as from Commorragh to the Craftworlds, ancient schemes come to fruition and a civil war between the Ynnari and their rivals brews. Meanwhile, a vast set of rules expansions enhance your Drukhari and Craftworlds armies with name generators, updated datasheets, and in-depth rules that let you create your own Craftworlds, Kabals and more!

Inside this 80-page book, you'll find:


     Background that brings the full impact of the Great Rift upon the Aeldari to life, examining the rifts formed between various factions in their society, the rising belief in Ynnead, the predations of Slaanesh, and more!
     Missions that allow you to recreate some of the most pivotal battles involving the Aeldari during the psychic awakening, and war zones that let you bring your battles to some of the most pivotal sites of conflict
     Expanded army rules for the Craftworlds, including alternative Exarch abilities, updated datasheets for Jain Zar and Howling Banshees, a new Psychic Discipline, and a system that allows you to build your own Craftworld Attributes
     Expanded army rules for the Drukhari, including updated datasheers for Drazhar and Incubi, name generation tables, and a system that lets you build your own Kabals, Wych Cults and Haemonculus Covens
     Expanded army rules for the Ynnari, including army-wide abilities, datasheets and matched play points for The Visarch, The Yncarne and Yvraine, Warlord Traits, Stratagems, the Revenant Psychic Discipline, Relics of Ynnead and more!


—description from the publisher

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Eighth Edition): Codex Supplement – Raven Guard
Description:
The Raven Guard are the Sons of Corax, and in the art of shadow warfare they are without equal. Theirs is the way of stealth, subterfuge and misdirection, ensuring their enemies are unaware of the true danger they face until it is far too late. Inside this 64-page hardback codex supplement, you'll find everything you need to unleash the Raven Guard in battle, plus thrilling lore and art to inspire your own collection.

Inside this book, you'll find:

     The history of the Raven Guard and their dark heritage, wreathed in shadows and born from the acts of treachery during the Horus Heresy that almost wiped out the Chapter
     A detailed description of Chapter organisation and iconography
     A Raven Guard bestiary with a detailed background for Kayvaan Shrike
     A showcase of stunningly painted Citadel miniatures
     Rules for Kayvaan Shrike, Chapter Master of the Raven Guard
     Stratagems, Warlord Traits, Tactical Objectives, Relics of the Ravenspire, the Umbramancy discipline, defining the ways that the Raven Guard wage war
     And more!


You will need a copy of Codex: Space Marines and the Warhammer 40,000 rulebook to use the rules included in this codex supplement.

—description from the publisher

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Eighth Edition): Codex Supplement – Salamanders
Description:
The sons of the Great Khan are amongst the most naturally skilled warriors fighting to defend the Imperium, and fall upon their foThe Salamanders are among the noblest of the Adeptus Astartes, fighting without hesitation to defend those who cannot protect themselves. Yet this empathy belies an incredible determination in battle, for the Salamanders are masters of fire and fury, armed with masterwork wargear forged by their most skilled artificers. In this 64-page hardback codex supplement, you'll find everything you need to unleash the Salamanders in battle, plus thrilling lore and art to inspire your own collection.

Inside this book, you'll find:

     The history of the Salamanders, and how they unleash the molten fury of their volcanic world upon their foes with their devastating artisan wargear
     A detailed description of Chapter organisation and iconography
     A Salamanders bestiary with a detailed background for Forgefather Vulkan He'stan and Captain Adrax Agatone of the 3rd Company
     Rules for Vulkan He'stan and Captain Agatone
     A showcase of stunningly painted Citadel miniatures
     Stratagems, Warlord Traits, Tactical Objectives, Relics of Nocturne, the Promethean discipline, defining the ways that the Salamanders wage war
     And more!


You will need a copy of Codex: Space Marines and the Warhammer 40,000 rulebook to use the rules included in this codex supplement.

—description from the publisher

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Eighth Edition): Codex Supplement – White Scars
Description:
The sons of the Great Khan are amongst the most naturally skilled warriors fighting to defend the Imperium, and fall upon their foes with unmatched speed and ferocity. Inside this 64-page hardback codex supplement, you'll find everything you need to unleash the White Scars in battle, plus thrilling lore and art to inspire your own collection.

Inside this book, you'll find:

     The history of the White Scars, with a look at how they masterfully employ lightning warfare to confound and defeat their enemies
     A detailed description of Chapter organisation and iconography
     A White Scars bestiary with background details for every unit and Character featured
     A showcase of stunningly painted Citadel miniatures
     Rules for units that are only available to the White Scars Chapter and their successors 
     Stratagems, Warlord Traits, Tactical Objectives, Relics of Chogoris, the Stormspeaking discipline, defining the ways that the White Scars wage war
     And more!


You will need a copy of Codex: Space Marines and the Warhammer 40,000 rulebook to use the rules included in this codex supplement.

—description from the publisher

Name: Red Feathers and Delaware Blues
Description:
Re-enact the battles of the American War of Independence in miniature with these wargames rules: Red Feathers & Delaware Blues.

This system gives an enjoyable game of medium length (2-3 hours) that catches the flavour of the American War of Independence. These rules should enable you to fight a battle where the units move and react in a way that is authentic.

Although it is marketed towards 6mm figures, any scale can be used, right up to 28mm.

—description from the publisher

Note: "Delaware Blues" refers to the 1st Delaware Regiment.

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Eighth Edition): Codex Supplement – Ultramarines
Description:
The Ultramarines are the noble sons of Roboute Guilliman and exemplars of everything it means to be a Space Marine. Inside this 80-page hardback codex supplement, you'll find everything you need to unleash the Ultramarines in battle, plus thrilling lore and art to inspire your own collection.

Inside this book, you'll find:


     The history of the Ultramarines, with a look at how they champion the use of the Codex Astartes to defeat their enemies at every turn
     A detailed description of Chapter organisation and iconography
     An Ultramarines bestiary with background details for every unit and Character featured
     A showcase of stunningly painted Citadel miniatures
     Rules for units that are only available to the Ultramarines Chapter and their successors 
     Stratagems, Warlord Traits, Tactical Objectives, Relics of Macragge, the Indomitus discipline, defining the ways that the Ultramarines wage war
     And more!


You will need a copy of Codex: Space Marines and the Warhammer 40,000 rulebook to use the rules included in this codex supplement.

—description from the publisher

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Eighth Edition): Codex Supplement – Imperial Fists
Description:
The Imperial Fists are the most stalwart of all Adeptus Astartes, and their stoicism in battle is legendary. When not serving in their celebrated role as Sentinels of Terra, the Imperial Fists ply the stars aboard their matchless battle station, Phalanx, to defeat the Emperor's foes wherever they may be found. Inside this 64-page hardback codex supplement, you'll find everything you need to unleash the Imperial Fists in battle, plus thrilling lore and art to inspire your own collection.

Inside this book, you'll find:

     The history of the Imperial Fists and their relentless determination to live up to the exacting standards of their Primarch, Rogal Dorn
     A detailed description of Chapter organisation and iconography
     An Imperial Fists bestiary with a detailed background for Captain Darnath Lysander of the 1st Company and Captain Tor Garadon of the 3rd Company
     Key background information on the Crimson Fists – the legendary successor Chapter of the Imperial Fists – and a bestiary of Pedro Kantor, their valiant Chapter Master
     A showcase of stunningly painted Citadel miniatures
     Rules for Captain Lysander, Captain Garadon and Chapter Master Pedro Kantor
     Stratagems, Warlord Traits, Tactical Objectives, Relics of the Fists and the Geokinesis discipline, defining the ways that the Imperial Fists wage war
     And more!


You will need a copy of Codex: Space Marines and the Warhammer 40,000 rulebook to use the rules included in this codex supplement.

—description from the publisher

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Eighth Edition): Codex Supplement – Iron Hands
Description:
The Iron Hands are one with the machine. They are among the most stoic and relentless of all Adeptus Astartes, ever willing to show the superiority of their bionic augmetics in battle to prove their belief that the flesh is weak. Inside this 64-page hardback codex supplement, you'll find everything you need to unleash the Iron Hands in battle, plus thrilling lore and art to inspire your own collection.

Inside this book, you'll find:

     The history of the Iron Hands and their drive for cold, emotionless perfection, to cast off weakling flesh and embrace the unyielding fortitude of the machine
     A detailed description of Chapter organisation and iconography
     An Iron Hands bestiary with a detailed background for Iron Father Feirros, the Master of the Forge
     A showcase of stunningly painted Citadel miniatures
     Rules for Iron Father Feirros
     Stratagems, Warlord Traits, Tactical Objectives, Relics of Medusa, the Technomancy discipline, defining the ways that the Iron Hands wage war
     And more!


You will need a copy of Codex: Space Marines and the Warhammer 40,000 rulebook to use the rules included in this codex supplement.

—description from the publisher

Name: Conan: The Shadow Kingdom
Description: A Hero steps from the mists of time to aid King Conan against an invisible threat. But behind this man stalks a threat older than the Earth itself.

Name: Conan: The Hidden Chambers
Description:
The Hidden Chambers expansion offers 4 mini maps that represent secret rooms. Once you find the door and pick its lock, you may enter the gloomy depths to find treasures, special items, or—perhaps—death. These Chamber Boards are set alongside the main game board, denoting a separate floor or level rather than altering an existing room.

Depths of the Lost Citadel

As well as offering brand new options for scenario designers, the Hidden Chambers Map Expansion also comes with its own special solo/co-op scenarios and an Adventure Mode scenario for the new Citadel map—“In the Depths of the Lost Citadel”. These scenarios require the core/retail version of Conan (or King or Barbarian pledge) and the new Conqueror expansion.

Players will assume the roles of hired swords with a mission: enter the lost citadel of an ancient sorcerer and steal a fabled artefact. To manage this dangerous feat, they must avoid traps, uncover secret doors, and battle the unspeakable horrors lurking beneath. And even if they manage all this, it is unlikely the sorcerer will let them leave with their lives.

For solo/co-op mode, this expansion will allow players to add an optional scenario to the campaign offered in the Tome of Skelos.

-Description by the publisher

Notes:
• The Depths of the Lost Citadel Adventure Mode scenario is included in the Tome of Skelos (pages 60-62). Two coop-solo Hidden Chambers scenarios are also included in the Tome of Skelos: scenario 3.5, "On the Edge" (pp. 25-26), and 5.5 "Citadel of Horrors" (pp. 33-35).
• This first "Hidden Chamber" offering (2 tiles/4 sides + 8 tokens) was issued in a small cardboard box for the Conan the Conqueror Kickstarter - another Hidden Chamber Tile was added to the later Conan: Red Nails Kickstarter (2025 release) as a stretch goal.

Name: Pic-Assiette
Description:
The card game for appetizing kids!

A funny game learning how to make and complete well-balanced seasonal meals, but watch out for the SuperMenu!

Pic-Assiette ("Supermenu") is a game based on nutrition, with a simple message : it is OK to eat everything, but in a balanced way. The objective is to be the first one to create a full menu : starter, main course, side dish, desert, glass of water.

“Special” cards will spice the game up all along: SuperMenu, Berk, Whipped Cream, Disease, Birthday, …

—description from the publisher (translated)

LE JEU DE CARTES QUI OUVRE L’APPETIT !

Un jeu pour s’amuser à composer des menus variés, de saison et toujours équilibrés … mais gare au Pic-Assiette !

PIC-ASSIETTE est un jeu de cartes basé sur la nutrition pour apprendre, en s’amusant, à manger de tout et de manière équilibrée. L’objectif est d’être le premier à composer son menu varié et équilibré en moins de 7 fourchettes : entrée, plat, accompagnement, dessert et verre d’eau. Mais en composant son menu, des cartes "spéciales" viennent pimenter la sauce : Pic-Assiette, Cola, Beurk, Anniversaire, Chantilly,…

—description from the publisher

Name: Near and Far: Bounty Hunter Character Tiles
Description:
Two character tiles depicting bounty hunters, available as part of the Secret Cabal Gaming Podcast 2019 Tabletop Media Bonanza Kickstarter campaign (2019 Promo Pack).

The tiles are double-sided with one side to be used with Near and Far and the other with Above and Below.

Name: Fireball Island: The Curse of Vul-Kar – Alien Brain Promo Card
Description:

Name: Memoir '28: Campaign book – Rush to Victory
Description:
Rush to Victory are 28mm Wargame rules for North Africa.

This is a Campaign system.
The actual game rules are based on the Memoir'44 boardgame.

You will need a copy of the boardgame in order to play.

These rules enables you to take the boardgame to the tabletop.
Rush to Victory is a campaign system that enables 2 players or 2 teams of players to play a series of 9 games and counter-attacks to determine the fate of the free world.

—description from the publisher

Name: Cthulhu: A Deck Building Game – Chef & Sea Captain promos
Description:
Two promo Investigator cards: Chef and Sea Captain.

Available as part of the Secret Cabal Gaming Podcast 2019 Tabletop Media Bonanza Kickstarter campaign (2019 Promo Pack).

Name: Coup de pute
Description:
literally translated by: whore trick

Players score points by doing dirty tricks in a specific situation by associating cards in their hands. The dirtiest one scores (decided by the current GM player). Rules also change from turn to turn.
Players keep going until one reaches 5 points.

—user summary

Le nouveau jeu by Topito : soyez la pire enflure et remportez la partie !

En associant des cartes " situation ", " personnage ", " action " et " objet ", fomentez le pire coup de pute possible : tous les coups sont permis ! Et n'oubliez pas, même les règles du jeu sont pleines de bassesses, changent à chaque situation pour plus de piment... et risquent de vous surprendre au pire moment !

Cartes Situations :
À l'enterrement de ma mamie...
Règle coup de pute de la situation : chaque joueur donne 2 cartes objet à son voisin de gauche.
C'est le jour de mon mariage...
Règle coup de pute : si un joueur prononce le mot " le ", il reçoit une pichenette.
J'ai une vilaine infection urinaire...
Règle coup de pute : le joueur le plus jeune passe son tour.

Cartes Personnages :
Ton papa chéri, Jean-Luc Mélenchon, un dealer chauve et aveugle, le gentil facteur, ta mère, ton cousin qui a été adopté...

Cartes Objets :
Ton utérus, un ticket de loto gagnant, un buste de Dany Boon, un slip sale, un iPhone neuf, un couteau mal aiguisé

Cartes Actions :
Prendre en bouche, jongler, insérer, passer au four, se moucher dans, gratter...

—description from the publisher

Name: in-quest
Description:
in-quest

space-age stimulation

Learn to Use the Scientific Method of Solving Problems

2 to 4 Players -- For teens and adults

Players compete to detect Errors in "Scintific Reasoning". Some are simple; some are subtle. If all players agree on the type of Error, each scores equally. But if opinions differ, the MINORITY VOTER may BOLD CHALLENGE for big rewards -- or penalties. Twenty investigations make a round. Eight rounds included.

Fun game for the curious

—description from the box

Name: Hot Tub High Dive
Description:
In Hot Tub High Dive by Hasbro Games, players spin the spinner, then press the big red button the number of times shown to send the diver up or down the ladder. Every press of the button increases the amount of foam in the tub. Once the diver reaches the top of the ladder, he will fall into the tub, launching a ball of suds at the unlucky player. The only player not to cause the diver to fall and the foam to fly wins the game.

—description from the publisher

Description: A new Chump Minion (size I) first available during the Promo Paradise Kickstarter campaign by The Board Game Spotlight.

Name: Bingolette
Description:
Each player has 7 game pieces, numbered from 2 to 8 and 28 tiles. The game pieces move around two tracks around the game board. movement is determined by a die. Each piece may change tracks once in it's movement. If a game piece lands on a numbered space, the numbers of the game piece and the space are multiplied. On the score section of the game board the result is covered with a tile.

The game ends, when 1 player has used all 28 tiles and has all his pieces in play. The winner is either the player who has covered the most spaces on the score section or the player who has covered the highest total of numbers.

—user summary

Name: Statera
Description:
Statera is a double-asymmetric strategy game with a huge amount of replayability.

Statera is a double-asymmetric strategy game with real scales. Its stories give players a lot of replayability and modular game map new experiences for each game. Become a leader of a Statera nation or a powerful God, fight for the territory, balance your believers, gather souls, and experience all of Statera's stories.

You can pick a different story for each game to determine the basic game's setup, get a richer experience, and learn more about the game world's story. By choosing to play for the nations of Statera or their gods you can also select the game's difficulty and the game's length.

In the Statera you will play as one of the nations of Statera or their God. The game is double-asymmetric. The first asymmetry comes from the difference between Gods and Staterans, second, there is an asymmetry between the factions. Some rules and patterns apply to the whole game, some only for Gods or Staterans, and some rules are specific to the faction.

The game is story-based. Each story tells a tale from the land of Statera and through that, it defines a number of players, unique victory conditions, setup, and some small rule adjustments. It basically means that each story, when played, feels like a different game.

The scale rising above the game board is a big part of Statera - the game and the world. The Stories already created for the game, are using the scale to count souls, balance them, lean towards a specific campsite, or take souls away from it. This component is simply crucial to play the game!

The important question is - Are you a brave Stateran, or a mighty god? It is time to lean the scale in your favor!

—description from the publisher

Name: Colors of Paris: Promo Tiles
Description:
Four women painters to add to the game: Rosa Bonheur, Mary Cassatt, Berthe Morisot and Suzanne Valadon.

This promo was distributed during the Festival international des jeux (FIJ) in Cannes.

Name: Imperial Settlers: Roll & Write – FIJ 2020 Promosheet
Description: Alternative village sheet (with Abbaye du Mont-Saint-Michel, Dune du Pilat, Palais des festivals, Musée du Louvre, Pont du Gard, Carcassonne) that was originally given as a promotional item at the Festival international des jeux (FIJ) in Cannes.

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Eighth Edition): Chapter Approved – 2018 Edition
Description:
Chapter Approved 2018 is the essential gaming toolbox for all Warhammer 40,000 fans. Whether you’re a loremaster looking to build rich campaigns to matched play maniacs looking for the latest balance updates, or just looking for something completely new, you’ll find something inside to pique your interest.

Inside the eBook of Chapter Approved 2018, you'll find:

– A full beta codex for the Sisters of Battle, letting you join in with the world’s biggest playtest as well as trying the new rules early!
– New profiles, rules and matched play points for the Eight, Commander Farsight’s battlesuit-armoured elite
– A section on Looted Wagons that lets you design and convert any kind of ramshackle Ork vehicle you can imagine, then use it in open play
– The latest matched play points updates, painstakingly balanced and tuned in conjunction with major tournament organisers and our playtesters.

Experiment with new rules, build your own characters, try new missions – however you play, Chapter Approved has something for you and is a fitting guide to another incredible year of Warhammer 40,000.

—description from the publisher

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Eighth Edition): Chapter Approved – 2019 Edition
Description:
Chapter Approved 2019 is the essential gaming toolbox for all Warhammer 40,000 fans. Whether you're looking to compile all of the rules that have featured in White Dwarf magazine throughout the year, or are looking for something new to expand your gaming experience, this is the perfect gaming supplement for you! Inside this 112-page softback book, you'll find:


     Rules for Spearhead – an expansion centred around tanks and vehicular combat



     Guidelines for linking your games of Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team, Warhammer 40,000 and Warhammer 40000: Apocalypse



     Loads of new Missions as well as updates to terrain rules and datasheets for certain Chaos Daemons units



     And much, much more…


In addition, you'll also find a separate 56-page book containing all the latest matched play points updates, painstakingly balanced and tuned in conjunction with major tournament organisers and our playtesters.

Whether you like to experiment with new rules, missions and expansions, or combine your campaigns like never before – however you play, Chapter Approved has something for you and is a fitting guide to another incredible year of Warhammer 40,000.

—description from the publisher

Name: Apéro Humour
Description:
200+ humorous questions for an evening between friends.

Présentation de l'éditeur:

Plus de 200 questions amusantes et humoristiques pour animer soirées et apéritifs entre amis. 200 questions avec un brin d'humour à consommer sans modération entre amis ou en famille  !

Fous rires garantis pour des apéritifs réussis  !

Name: The Enigma Experiences
Description:
The Enigma Experiences: an artwork turned into a new gaming experience in which creativity, technology and history are combined.
We present you with a unique experience and a new entertainment system, which goes hand in hand with an amazing object in a completely revolutionary game. Imagine for a moment the thrill of being able to investigate and solve great mysteries, while enjoying playing exciting games and solving riddles with your friends and/or family!

What makes THE ENIGMA EXPERIENCES so special? 

     It is a completely new, unique and original concept: an artwork turned into a new gaming experience in which creativity, technology and history are combined.
     It is one of the best games of research and intrigue this year, designed to be enjoyed alone or with friends and/or family.
     It has been created in such a way that players can experience and experiment first-hand with technologies such as Virtual Reality (VR), Augmented Reality (AR) and Artificial Intelligence (AI).
     It's so easy to use, even our grandmothers have been able to play it! Despite being considered a very elaborate game with many carefully chosen details, no knowledge or preparation is needed to enjoy it.


Our product is going to be manufactured and assembled in Europe. To produce our game and its elements we use materials from Europe and the U.S. 
Feel the emotions that will arise from our experiences. Imagine having in your hands the most exciting challenges that the greatest researchers from all over the world have faced, and solve them yourself.

—description from the publisher
